titleStmt.title: Afraid of Dogs Harran
SHAWI Corpus

monogr.title: A Digital Dictionary of Shawi Arabic

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the dict prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a entry in the SHAWI glossary.
Private URIs using the rend prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a rendition element in VICAV rendition library.

spanGrp.span: Master, once upon a time there was a guest in a house. He had come as a guest and in the evening they made for him chickpea stew.
They cooked chickpea stew for dinner and the man ate the chickpea stew. After they had eaten they chatted until night. When bedtime had come they prepared a mattress for the guest.
After they had prepared the bed for him, the guest went to sleep. But at one, two or three in the night his stomach began to ache.
He wanted to ease nature outside, he wanted to got to the toilet. – To the privy? – Yes, to the privy.
He got up at night and when he came to the antechamber he spotted a dog the size of a wolf. They had a dog.
Grrrr! My goodness! Dear me! This one will not let me go out, he will eat me. So, he returned inside.
He went back and entered the bed again. He lay down and was rolling (in bed) like this.
Again he felt the urge to go to the toilet. He wanted to go to the antechamber in order to go outside. He said, “Perhaps it (the dog) has moved to another place.”
He came again, but when he put his foot outside the door, again it snarled: Grrr! Tsk! Dear me! He will eat me today; I cannot go outside. Today he will make me defacate on myself.
Coming back he recognized a nappy in the corner. He saw the nappy. The hosts had a small child who was sleeping in the cradle.
He took the nappy, defacated inside and rolled the nappy up. It was during the night when they were sleeping.
He opened the one of the child, the nappy of the child, put (his nappy) there, tied and donned it to the child and went to bed.
Tsk! He went to bed. In the morning the woman said, “Yuck! What a bad smell! A child who shits only that little does not produce such a smell. What kind of smell is this?”
When she had opened the nappy of the child she looked and saw that the shit was full of chickpeas.
She said, “Man, I feed our boy with milk. Where do these chickpeas come from? She took it, wiped it off, cleaned it and threw the chickpeas away.
In the morning they said to the guest, “O sincere guest, this morning our child had defecated chickpeas, although we had not fed him chickpeas. How come?”
He said, “By God, I will tell you something.” They said, “What?” He said, “As long as this dog will sleep here at the door, your child will continue to shit chickpeas.” Hahaha! Enjoy it!
